thread.title: Daniel Craig and David Oyelowo to star in 'Othello' in NYC
thread.title_full: Daniel Craig and David Oyelowo to star in 'Othello' in NYC

title: Daniel Craig and David Oyelowo to star in 'Othello' in NYC
text:
Updated: 12:50 p.m. Monday, Oct. 19, 2015 | Posted: 12:50 p.m. Monday, Oct. 19, 2015 Daniel Craig and David Oyelowo to star in 'Othello' in NYC FILE - This is a Wednesday, Jan. 7, 2015 file photo of British actor Daniel Craig as he poses during a photo call in Soelden, Austrian province of Tyrol, where the 007 movie "Spectre" is being shot. James Bond actor Craig was on the island Cyprus Tuesday Oct. 13, 2015 to inspect the United Nations’ work to clear minefields, a vestige of conflict that divided this east Mediterranean island along ethnic lines. (AP Photo/Kerstin Joensson, File) Related View Larger Steve Granitz / Getty Images LOS ANGELES, CA - SEPTEMBER 20: Actors David Oyelowo (L) and Jessica Oyelowo attend the 67th Annual Primetime Emmy Awards at Microsoft Theater on September 20, 2015 in Los Angeles, California. (Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) View Larger FILE - In this Dec. 4, 2014, file photo actor Daniel Craig poses for photographers at the announcement for the new Bond film, the 24th in the series, at Pinewood Studios in west London. A couple of big-time movie stars will be appearing off-Broadway in fall 2016 when Craig and David Oyelowo appear in a production of William Shakespeare’s “Othello” at New York Theatre Workshop. Sam Gold, a Tony-winner for “Fun Home” will direct the tragedy, with “Selma” star Oyelowo playing the title role and super spy 007 Craig as Iago. (Photo by Joel Ryan/Invision/AP, File) View Larger FILE - In this Sept. 20, 2015 file photo, David Oyelowo arrives at the 67th Primetime Emmy Awards at the Microsoft Theater in Los Angeles. A couple of big-time movie stars will be appearing off-Broadway in fall 2016 when Daniel Craig and Oyelowo appear in a production of William Shakespeare’s “Othello” at New York Theatre Workshop. Sam Gold, a Tony-winner for “Fun Home” will direct the tragedy, with “Selma” star Oyelowo playing the title role and super spy 007 Craig as Iago. (Photo by Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP, File) Sponsored Links The Associated Press NEW YORK — 
A couple of big-time movie stars will be appearing off-Broadway next fall when Daniel Craig and David Oyelowo star in a production of William Shakespeare's "Othello" at New York Theatre Workshop. 
Sam Gold, a Tony-winner for "Fun Home" will direct the tragedy, with "Selma" star Oyelowo playing the title role and super spy 007 Craig as Iago. The show is slated for fall 2016 and additional casting will be announced later. 
Like Hamlet and Macbeth, Othello is a Shakespearean protagonist driven mad by suspicion and fear. In the play, Othello's trusted lieutenant spins a web to make him doubt his wife's fidelity. 
Craig plays James Bond in "Spectre" out next month and Oyelowo is next slated to co-star with Zoe Saldana in "Nina" about singer Nina Simone. 
___
